<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<h:html xmlns:h="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:orx="http://openrosa.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2002/xforms" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:jr="http://openrosa.org/javarosa" xmlns:vellum="http://commcarehq.org/xforms/vellum">
	<h:head>
		<h:title>Close</h:title>
		<model>
			<instance>
				<data xmlns:jrm="http://dev.commcarehq.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://openrosa.org/formdesigner/5CCB1614-68B3-44C0-A166-D63AA7C1D4FB" uiVersion="1" version="1" name="Close">
					<welcome_message />
					<close_confirmation />
					<close_reason />
				</data>
			</instance>
			<bind nodeset="/data/welcome_message" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/close_confirmation" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/close_reason" type="xsd:string" relevant="/data/close_confirmation = 'yes'" />
			<itext>
				<translation lang="en" default="">
					<text id="welcome_message-label">
						<value>This is a close form.  It lets you select a already registered case and remove it from the phone. Its important to remove cases from the phone so that the user only sees the cases that are actionable to them.  However, all information collected about the case will still be stored on CommCareHQ.  

* You can add questions to collect information about why the case is being closed
* You can also save this information to the case (before closing it) on the main form page

For more help, view our [help on building forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder) and [case management guidance](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the main form page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
						<value form="markdown">This is a close form.  It lets you select a already registered case and remove it from the phone. Its important to remove cases from the phone so that the user only sees the cases that are actionable to them.  However, all information collected about the case will still be stored on CommCareHQ.  

* You can add questions to collect information about why the case is being closed
* You can also save this information to the case (before closing it) on the main form page

For more help, view our [help on building forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder) and [case management guidance](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the main form page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
					</text>
					<text id="close_confirmation-label">
						<value>Confirm case close</value>
					</text>
					<text id="close_confirmation-yes-label">
						<value>Yes</value>
					</text>
					<text id="close_confirmation-no-label">
						<value>No</value>
					</text>
					<text id="close_reason-label">
						<value>Close Reason</value>
					</text>
				</translation>
			</itext>
		</model>
	</h:head>
	<h:body>
		<trigger ref="/data/welcome_message" appearance="minimal">
			<label ref="jr:itext('welcome_message-label')" />
		</trigger>
		<select1 ref="/data/close_confirmation">
			<label ref="jr:itext('close_confirmation-label')" />
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('close_confirmation-yes-label')" />
				<value>yes</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('close_confirmation-no-label')" />
				<value>no</value>
			</item>
		</select1>
		<input ref="/data/close_reason">
			<label ref="jr:itext('close_reason-label')" />
		</input>
	</h:body>
</h:html>
_attachments.219abee2ebd01598c8d497d42e96983d784d65b2:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<h:html xmlns:h="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:orx="http://openrosa.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2002/xforms" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:jr="http://openrosa.org/javarosa" xmlns:vellum="http://commcarehq.org/xforms/vellum">
	<h:head>
		<h:title>Visit</h:title>
		<model>
			<instance>
				<data xmlns:jrm="http://dev.commcarehq.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://openrosa.org/formdesigner/52D111C9-79C6-403F-BF4C-D24B64A872E2" uiVersion="1" version="1" name="Visit">
					<welcome_message />
					<sample_choice_question />
					<sample_number_question />
				</data>
			</instance>
			<bind nodeset="/data/welcome_message" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/sample_choice_question" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/sample_number_question" type="xsd:int" />
			<itext>
				<translation lang="en" default="">
					<text id="welcome_message-label">
						<value>This is a follow up form.  It lets you select a already registered case and collect information about it.  You can then save this information to the case, or update information that is already there (ex. child's weight). 

* To setup how the list of cases will look on the phone, choose the Follow Up module, and then choose which case properties you want to display in the list and detail ([Case List and Detail](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+List+and+Case+Detail+Configuration))
* You can add text, number, choice or other question types to the form
* For choice questions, use the circle button in the toolbar to add more choices. 
* On the main form page, you can choose which of these questions you want to *save to the case*

For more help, view our [help on building forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder) and [case management guidance](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the main form page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
						<value form="markdown">This is a follow up form.  It lets you select a already registered case and collect information about it.  You can then save this information to the case, or update information that is already there (ex. child's weight). 

* To setup how the list of cases will look on the phone, choose the Follow Up module, and then choose which case properties you want to display in the list and detail ([Case List and Detail](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+List+and+Case+Detail+Configuration))
* You can add text, number, choice or other question types to the form
* For choice questions, use the circle button in the toolbar to add more choices. 
* On the main form page, you can choose which of these questions you want to *save to the case*

For more help, view our [help on building forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder) and [case management guidance](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the main form page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-label">
						<value>Sample Choice Question</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice1-label">
						<value>Choice 1</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice2-label">
						<value>Choice 2</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice3-label">
						<value>Choice 3</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_number_question-label">
						<value>Sample Number Question</value>
					</text>
				</translation>
			</itext>
		</model>
	</h:head>
	<h:body>
		<trigger ref="/data/welcome_message" appearance="minimal">
			<label ref="jr:itext('welcome_message-label')" />
		</trigger>
		<select1 ref="/data/sample_choice_question">
			<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-label')" />
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice1-label')" />
				<value>choice1</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice2-label')" />
				<value>choice2</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice3-label')" />
				<value>choice3</value>
			</item>
		</select1>
		<input ref="/data/sample_number_question">
			<label ref="jr:itext('sample_number_question-label')" />
		</input>
	</h:body>
</h:html>
_attachments.73509e3988e9415dc58b2c560e93e1bbcc8f542a:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<h:html xmlns:h="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:orx="http://openrosa.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2002/xforms" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:jr="http://openrosa.org/javarosa" xmlns:vellum="http://commcarehq.org/xforms/vellum">
	<h:head>
		<h:title>Registration</h:title>
		<model>
			<instance>
				<data xmlns:jrm="http://dev.commcarehq.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://openrosa.org/formdesigner/11FAC65A-F2CD-427F-A870-CF126336AAB5" uiVersion="1" version="1" name="Registration">
					<welcome_message />
					<name />
					<sample_choice_question />
					<sample_number_question />
				</data>
			</instance>
			<bind nodeset="/data/welcome_message" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/name" type="xsd:string" required="true()" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/sample_choice_question" />
			<bind nodeset="/data/sample_number_question" type="xsd:int" />
			<itext>
				<translation lang="en" default="">
					<text id="welcome_message-label">
						<value>This is a registration form.  It creates new items (**Cases**) to track.  You can save some or all of this questions in this form to the case.  You can then display this information on the phone to help choose which case to do a follow up with, or for logic in other forms.  

Add questions to the form using the toolbar above.  
* You can add text, number, choice or other question types.  
* For choice questions, use the circle button in the toolbar to add more choices. 
* For a given question, set the Question ID to the name of your data variable (on the form and on the case) and the Label to the text you want to show to the user
* On the main form page, you can choose which of these questions you want to *save to the case*

For more help, view our [help on building forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder) and [case management guidance](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the main form page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
						<value form="markdown">This is a registration form.  It creates new items (**Cases**) to track.  You can save some or all of this questions in this form to the case.  You can then display this information on the phone to help choose which case to do a follow up with, or for logic in other forms.  

Add questions to the form using the toolbar above.  
* You can add text, number, choice or other question types.  
* For choice questions, use the circle button in the toolbar to add more choices. 
* For a given question, set the Question ID to the name of your data variable (on the form and on the case) and the Label to the text you want to show to the user
* On the main form page, you can choose which of these questions you want to *save to the case*

For more help, view our [help on building forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder) and [case management guidance](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the main form page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
					</text>
					<text id="name-label">
						<value>Name</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-label">
						<value>Sample Choice Question</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice1-label">
						<value>Choice 1</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice2-label">
						<value>Choice 2</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice3-label">
						<value>Choice 3</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_number_question-label">
						<value>Sample Number Question</value>
					</text>
				</translation>
			</itext>
		</model>
	</h:head>
	<h:body>
		<trigger ref="/data/welcome_message" appearance="minimal">
			<label ref="jr:itext('welcome_message-label')" />
		</trigger>
		<input ref="/data/name">
			<label ref="jr:itext('name-label')" />
		</input>
		<select1 ref="/data/sample_choice_question">
			<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-label')" />
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice1-label')" />
				<value>choice1</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice2-label')" />
				<value>choice2</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice3-label')" />
				<value>choice3</value>
			</item>
		</select1>
		<input ref="/data/sample_number_question">
			<label ref="jr:itext('sample_number_question-label')" />
		</input>
	</h:body>
</h:html>
